ARABIC: أَتَّخَذْنَٰهُمْ سِخْرِيًّا أَمْ زَاغَتْ عَنْهُمُ ٱلْأَبْصَٰرُ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Did we turn them into figures of fun? Did our eyes disdain to look at them?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Did we laugh at them (for nothing), or our eyes fail to pick them out?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Is it that we mistakenly made fun of them; or have they disappeared from our sight?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and whom we mocked? Have they been rescued or can our eyes not find them?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “Did we mock at them or did our eyes turn away from them?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Did we take them as an object of mockery, or have (our) eyes failed to perceive them"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Was it that we (only) took them in scorn, or have our eyes (now) turned aside from them?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: What, did we take them for a laughing-stock? Or have our eyes swerved away from them?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Did we take them (wrongly) for a laughing-stock, or have our eyes missed them?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: [and] whom we made the target of our derision? Or are they here, and our eyes have missed them?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Took we them so unjustly for a butt of mockery, or are they deluding our eyes?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: ridiculing them, or do [our] eyes miss them [here]?’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Did we treat them (as such) in ridicule, or have (our) eyes failed to perceive them?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Did we take them as an object of mockery, or have (our) eyes failed to perceive them?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Have we taken them in mockery? Or, have our eyes swerved from them?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Did we take them for mockery, or have our eyes swerved from them?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Is it [because] we took them in ridicule, or has [our] vision turned away from them?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [38:63]   Did we treat them mockingly? (read sukhriyyan, or sikhriyyan), did we use to deride them in [the life of] the world (the [final] yā’ [in sikhriyyā] is attributive). In other words, are they missing? Or have [our] eyes missed them [here]?’, so that we have not caught sight of them. Such [men] were the poor among the Muslims, like ‘Ammār [b. Yāsir], Bilāl [al-Habashī], Suhayb [al-Rūmī] and Salmān [al-Fārisī].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Did we take them (wrongly) for a laughing stock) we made them subservient to us in the life of the world, (or have our eyes missed them) and we did not see them?
